articles.title: ‘And Just Like That,’ Michael Patrick King Talks Carrie Bradshaw’s Ending: “This Is Where We Wanted to Leave Her’ - The Hollywood Reporter
articles.description: The 'Sex and the City' writer-director and 'AJLT' showrunner explains to THR why he chose to end the beloved franchise (even though everyone's still talking about it).

articles.title: TIFF Officially Selects October 7th Documentary ‘The Road Between Us’ Amid Outcry - Deadline
articles.description: EXCLUSIVE: The Toronto Film Festival said Thursday that it will invite to its 50th edition Barry Avrich‘s October 7th documentary The Road Between Us: The Ultimate Rescue, two days after organizers rescinded their invitation for it to appear in the Documentar…

articles.title: ‘Night Always Comes’ Review: Vanessa Kirby Gets Put Through the Wringer in Netflix’s Grim Neo-Noir Odyssey - The Hollywood Reporter
articles.description: Jennifer Jason Leigh, Julia Fox and Eli Roth also appear in Benjamin Caron’s thriller about a Portland woman fighting to claw out a future for herself and her family.

articles.title: ‘The Traitors’ Coming to NBC With Non-Celebrity Season - Variety
articles.description: A new civilian-led version of the reality competition series “The Traitors” is heading to NBC with Alan Cumming as the host.

articles.title: WW2: How the Nanjing massacre still haunts China-Japan relations - BBC
articles.description: Eighty years after Japan was defeated, a wave of Chinese films about the  occupation are fuelling memory and anger.

articles.title: ‘Star Trek’ Is Born on ‘Strange New Worlds’ - Gizmodo
articles.description: 'The Sehlat Who Ate Its Tail' provides the crucible that 'Strange New Worlds' has been building towards since before it even existed: the forging of the team that made 'Star Trek'.

articles.title: The Duffer Brothers in Talks to Depart Netflix for Paramount - The Hollywood Reporter
articles.description: The 'Stranger Things' duo would reunite with their former Netflix compatriot Cindy Holland.

articles.title: Seizures Were Major Factor in Brandon Blackstock's Death Amid Melanoma Battle - TMZ
articles.description: Brandon Blackstock’s death certificate is revealing more about his passing from melanoma -- showing that seizures played a major role in his death.

articles.title: The Heartbreaking Life and Death of Danielle ‘Dee’ Spencer - The Root
articles.description: Behind all the laughter, actress Danielle Spencer endured a life riddled with extraordinary highs, devastating lows, and battles that would test even the strongest spirit.

articles.title: ‘Weapons’ Just Became the Rare Original Horror Movie to Hit $100 Million in Theaters - Bloody Disgusting
articles.description: It’s not very common for a non-franchise horror movie to hit $100 million at the box office, but Zach Cregger’s Weapons can already boast about hitting that milestone after just one week of release. The production budget for Weapons was a reported $38 million…

articles.title: Taylor Swift’s Debut on Travis Kelce’s ‘New Heights’ Podcast Instantly Smashes Ratings Records - Billboard
articles.description: Taylor Swift immediately set ratings records on boyfriend Travis Kelce's 'New Heights' podcast on (Aug. 13) while sharing TS12 album details.

articles.description: Dave Mustaine is saying goodbye to the thrash metal band he founded after being fired from Metallica in 1983

articles.title: 'The Last of Us' actor Pedro Pascal says he wouldn't want to survive an apocalypse - NPR
articles.description: The Chilean-born actor has faced countless on-screen challenges, including cosmic battles and cartel kingpins. He's nominated for an Emmy for his role on the HBO series, The Last of Us.

articles.title: 'Riverdale' star KJ Apa says parenthood made him 'understand the idea of murder' to protect son - Entertainment Weekly
articles.description: 'Riverdale' and upcoming Jimmy Stewart biopic actor KJ Apa said his son saved his life from substance abuse and allowed him to 'understand the idea of murder' to protect his child.

articles.title: Pete Davidson says he was 'embarrassed' by media attention over BDE: 'No one talked about any work I was doing' - Entertainment Weekly
articles.description: Pete Davidson opens up about feeling 'sexualized' by the media during his high-profile relationships: 'If that was a girl, people would be like, there would be a march for it.'

articles.title: ‘The View’ Host Ana Navarro Tells Gloria Gaynor to Reject Trump’s Kennedy Center Honor: He Has ‘Attacked the Rights of Women, People of Color and LGBTQ’ - Variety
articles.description: 'The View' co-host Ana Navarro posted a message on Instagram urging singer Gloria Gaynor to reject President Trump's Kennedy Center Honor.

articles.title: Bob Odenkirk Talks Potential ‘Nobody’ Quadrilogy, ‘Pluribus’ Hype and Not Missing Saul Goodman - The Hollywood Reporter
articles.description: After 14 years in the 'Breaking Bad' world, Odenkirk hasn't looked back, but says he'd be up for one (or two) more 'Nobody' films.

articles.title: ‘The Rainmaker’ Review: USA’s John Grisham Adaptation Ditches the Book’s Cynicism for More Frivolous Pleasures - The Hollywood Reporter
articles.description: John Slattery, Lana Parrilla and Milo Callaghan lead this take on the 1995 bestseller about the U.S. legal and healthcare industries, brought to the big screen by Francis Ford Coppola in 1997.
